results.definition: appear to move downward
examples: The sun dipped below the horizon

results.definition: switch (a car's headlights) from a higher to a lower beam
dip into a liquid while eating
a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
immerse briefly into a liquid so as to wet, coat, or saturate
examples: dip the garment into the cleaning solution
dip the brush into the paint

results.definition: a thief who steals from the pockets or purses of others in public places
dip into a liquid
(physics) the angle that a magnetic needle makes with the plane of the horizon
a brief swim in water
a brief immersion
a candle that is made by repeated dipping in a pool of wax or tallow
a depression in an otherwise level surface
examples: there was a dip in the road

results.definition: a gymnastic exercise on the parallel bars in which the body is lowered and raised by bending and straightening the arms
go down momentarily
immerse in a disinfectant solution
lower briefly
place (candle wicks) into hot, liquid wax
plunge (one's hand or a receptacle) into a container
scoop up by plunging one's hand or a ladle below the surface
examples: dip water out of a container

results.definition: slope downwards
examples: Our property dips towards the river

results.definition: stain an object by immersing it in a liquid
take a small amount from
examples: I had to dip into my savings to buy him this present

results.definition: tasty mixture or liquid into which bite-sized foods are dipped
